Question: how to get xml data stream from url and not just a file: :package org.me.myandroidstuff;import java.io.BufferedReader;import java.io.FileInputStream;import java.io.IOException;import java.io.InputStream;import java.io.InputStreamReader;import java.net.HttpURLConnection;import java.net.URL;import java.net.URLConnection;import java.util.List;import android.app.Activity;import android.graphics.Color;import android.os.Bundle;import android.view.Menu;import android.widget.ArrayAdapter;import android.widget.ListView;import android.widget.TextView;import org.me.myandroidstuff.CarParkClass;import org.me.myandroidstuff.XMLPullParserHandler;public class CarParkListingTestActivity extends Activity {ListView listView;private String url = "example.com?type=xml";@Overrideprotected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState){    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);    setContentView(R.layout.main);    listView = (ListView) findViewById(R.id.list);    List<CarParkClass> carparks = null;    try{        XMLPullParserHandler parser = new XMLPullParserHandler();        carparks = parser.parse(getAssets().open("carparks.xml"));        //InputStream is = new FileInputStream(url);        //carparks = parser.parse(is);        ArrayAdapter<CarParkClass> adapter =                 new ArrayAdapter<CarParkClass>(this,R.layout.list_item, carparks);        listView.setAdapter(adapter);    } catch(IOException e){        e.printStackTrace();    }    listView.setBackgroundColor(Color.WHITE);}@Overridepublic boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu){    //getMenuInflater().inflate(R.menu.main, menu);    return true;}I want to parse data from a url and not a file from the assets folder. How can i approach that step. I tried parsing from my assets folder, and the app work very well, but when i try parsing from the url as given it doesn't work. Your help is much appreciatedThanks
Please using this api: ProgressDialog.dismiss.

Question: how to get xml data stream from url and not just a file: :package org.me.myandroidstuff;import java.io.BufferedReader;import java.io.FileInputStream;import java.io.IOException;import java.io.InputStream;import java.io.InputStreamReader;import java.net.HttpURLConnection;import java.net.URL;import java.net.URLConnection;import java.util.List;import android.app.Activity;import android.graphics.Color;import android.os.Bundle;import android.view.Menu;import android.widget.ArrayAdapter;import android.widget.ListView;import android.widget.TextView;import org.me.myandroidstuff.CarParkClass;import org.me.myandroidstuff.XMLPullParserHandler;public class CarParkListingTestActivity extends Activity {ListView listView;private String url = "example.com?type=xml";@Overrideprotected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState){    super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);    setContentView(R.layout.main);    listView = (ListView) findViewById(R.id.list);    List<CarParkClass> carparks = null;    try{        XMLPullParserHandler parser = new XMLPullParserHandler();        carparks = parser.parse(getAssets().open("carparks.xml"));        //InputStream is = new FileInputStream(url);        //carparks = parser.parse(is);        ArrayAdapter<CarParkClass> adapter =                 new ArrayAdapter<CarParkClass>(this,R.layout.list_item, carparks);        listView.setAdapter(adapter);    } catch(IOException e){        e.printStackTrace();    }    listView.setBackgroundColor(Color.WHITE);}@Overridepublic boolean onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu){    //getMenuInflater().inflate(R.menu.main, menu);    return true;}I want to parse data from a url and not a file from the assets folder. How can i approach that step. I tried parsing from my assets folder, and the app work very well, but when i try parsing from the url as given it doesn't work. Your help is much appreciatedThanks
Please using this api: ProgressDialog.dismiss.
Answer: <<<api>>>: HttpURLConnection
<<<code>>>: 
URL url = new URL("http://example.com?type=xml");
HttpURLConnection conn = (HttpURLConnection) url.openConnection();
conn.setReadTimeout(10000 /* milliseconds */);
conn.setConnectTimeout(15000 /* milliseconds */);
conn.setRequestMethod("GET");
conn.setDoInput(true);
conn.connect();
InputStream stream = conn.getInputStream();

<<<explanation>>>: HttpURLConnection is a class that allows you to establish a connection to a URL and send an HTTP request. The request method is set to GET, which means the server will respond with the requested data. The response is then read from the InputStream.

You can then pass this InputStream to your XMLPullParserHandler to parse the XML data.

Please note that you should handle exceptions for network errors and make sure to disconnect from the server after you are done with the connection.

```java
try {
    // Your code here
} catch (IOException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
} finally {
    if (conn != null) {
        conn.disconnect();
    }
}
```

This way, you can get XML data from a URL and not just a file.

Also, you can use a ProgressDialog to show a loading indicator while the data is being fetched from the URL. You can dismiss the ProgressDialog in the finally block after you have disconnected from the server.

```java
ProgressDialog progressDialog = ProgressDialog.show(this, "Loading", "Please wait...", true);

try {
    // Your code here
} catch (IOException e) {
    e.printStackTrace();
} finally {
    if (conn != null) {
        conn.disconnect();
    }
    if (progressDialog.isShowing()) {
        progressDialog.dismiss();
    }
}
```

This way, the user will know that the app is fetching data from the URL and not frozen.
